title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Hi, got an 820-00165-A with no green light and no fan spin. Tried known working io board and cable

PP3V42_G3H: 3.42v

PPBUS_G3H: 8.16v

PP5V_S5: 0v

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Check SMC_RESET_L and Y5110 oscillation.
Fault history may help...

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
SMC_RESET_L IS 0V. 

Dont have oscilloscope. 

User says he was just using it and i stopped turning on.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: Post all U5110 voltages.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
PP3V42_G3H: 3.4V

PP3V42_G3H_SMC_SPVSR: 3.4V

SMC_MANUAL_RST_L: 2.7V

SMC_RESET_L: 0V

SMC_LSOC_RST_L: 3.4V 

SMC_ONOFF_L: 3.4V

PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: 3.3V

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: Check R5100 and clean J6100.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
R5100 is 84k

removed  J6100 no change

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Try removing R7100 now.
If still the same, remove Q5110 and check again SMC_RESET_L.
Last option, change SMC...

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: After U5110 removal i have 3.0v on SMC_RESET_L

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: Change the chip then...

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: changed the chip no change

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: Post again its voltages; with trackpad connected.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
PP3V42_G3H: 3.0V

PP3V42_G3H_SMC_SPVSR: 3.0V

SMC_MANUAL_RST_L: 0V

SMC_RESET_L: 0V

SMC_LSOC_RST_L: 3V

SMC_ONOFF_L: 3V

PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: 0.66V

Same voltages without trackpad, only PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC goes up a little to 0.7v

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
You are in worst scenario than before: lost two voltages.
Try another chip and be sure about solders.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Tried another U5110.

PP3V42_G3H: 3.0V

PP3V42_G3H_SMC_SPVSR: 3.0V

SMC_MANUAL_RST_L: 3V

SMC_RESET_L: 0V

SMC_LSOC_RST_L: 3V

SMC_ONOFF_L: 3V

PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: 0.7V (it goes to 0.7v down from 2v slowly)

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Check if R5100 has correct value.
Also check diode mode to ground at AVREF_SMC.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
R5100:  89.4 kohms

PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC diode mode:  .0L

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Carefully check power voltage directly to pins 1 & 3; do not make short between pins!
Be sure all traces and solders are good.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Voltage between pins 1 and 3 is 0v

Traces and solders are good

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Not between the pins; check voltage on pins 1 & 3 (to ground).
You've said to have 3V there; directly on the pins, or close components connected to the same lines?

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: Oh, sorry. Yes, i measured it directly the first time, not the components.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: Then try another U5110...

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Tried another U5110, no change.

Shouldn't PP3V42_G3H be 3.4v before U5110 brings SMC_RESET_L up?

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Ooops, it dropped to 3.0V exactly?
Inspect U7090 area for corrosion and check all its surrounding caps and resistors.
Post diode mode to ground at L7095.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
U7090 area looks good

L7095 diode mode: 0.268

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
A bit low, if measured with cold board.
Usual value is aprox 0.300 in diode mode (red to ground).
Check again removing U5110.

Did you reball SMC?

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
I replaced U7090 just in case, now L7095 diode mode is 0.279 and PP3V42_G3H dropped to 2.9v.

 L7095 diode mode is 0.265 with U5110 removed

Yes, i reballed the SMC

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: Did you let the board to cool down, before measuring diode mode?

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: Yes, i let i coold down

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Looks to low for me, but depends by multimeter.
Compare with the reading from good board.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: 0.275 on a good board

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Take this as reference for you multimeter then.
In this case, 3V42G3H power rail should be good.

The problem must be on U7090 area.
Check its traces, solders and surrounding components.
Pay atention to C7094 and R7095/96.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Traces are good, components are looking great.

Replaced C7094 and U7090 just in case. R7095/96 resistance reading is the same as good board.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: What is the actual voltage at C7098 and pin 1 of R7096?

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: Voltage at C7098 is 2.78v and pin 1 of R7096 1v

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: Compare voltage and diode mode readings with another multimeter.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Hi, got another multemeter. 

L7095 diode mode is now 0.280 and voltages at C7098 are 2.8v and pin 1 of R7096 1.1v

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Play with R7095/96 values to adjust output voltage.
Make use of the adjacent formula...

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Ive changed R7096 to 150k and then to 100k, but theres no change in PP3V42_G3H, still on 2.8v. 

P3V42G3H_FB is now 0.6v

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Feedback voltage must be 1.25V, like in formula.
Replaca U7090 again.
Be sure all traces are good.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: Replaced U7090 again, no feedback is 1.0v and PP3V42_G3H is 3.0v. I restored R7095/96 original values.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: Traces are good.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: What is actual diode mode to ground?

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
0.268 

PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H is 13.5v. It says it should be 18.5v. But theres a note that says the divider sets the ACIN threshold at 13.55v

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
U7090 VIN voltage should be almost same as charger voltage.
Be sure R7005 has correct value.

Are you using original 45/60W Magsafe 2 charger?
The voltage must be 14-16V in such case.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
C5010 was shorted. After replacing i now got 3.4v on PP3V42_G3H but still no green light.

PPBUS_G3H is 8.4v

PP5V_S5 is 0v and PP3V3_S5 is 0.5v

it seems that U7501 is not being enabled.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: U5110 output voltage correct now?

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Now PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC is 3.3v

SMC_RESET_L is 3.4v

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: SMC_PM_G2_EN comes on?

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message: SMC_PM_G2_EN not present.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Reball SMC first.
You may need to change it.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
I reballed the SMC, no change.

Tried to turn it on SMC bypass, no reaction. Is it still possible to be a bad SMC?

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Be sure to get 12MHz oscillation at Y5110.
Post its DC voltage at least.

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Dont have Oscope. 

No voltage on neither SMC_XTAL_R or SMC_XTAL

title: 820-00165-A no green light no fan spin
message:
Change Y5110 and adjacents components.
You should get 1-1.2V DC voltage on its terminals.
If still the same, change SMC.
Once removed, check traces from SMC pads to Y5110.
